Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on past persecution and threats
Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Physical assault and threats by criminal associates
Crimes.Victim_Status: Mr. Kudar, a private individual targeted due to conflict with a powerful figure
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: History of harassment, violence, and organized criminal influence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Atyanski convicted and sentenced; diminished influence
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Atyanski involved in organized crime and corruption
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – linked to organized crime and political corruption
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Partially credible, but not sufficient to establish current risk
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: RPD found Mr. Kudar’s fear subjective rather than objectively founded
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Non-state actor threat mitigated by legal action and law enforcement capacity
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – Mr. Kudar specifically targeted by Atyanski's group
Crimes.Targeted_Individual_Status: Civilian, former target of criminal harassment
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Hungarian legal jurisdiction with Canadian refugee determination review
Crimes.Governing_Law: IRPA and international refugee law principles
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Well-founded fear of persecution; risk to life or cruel treatment
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to Convention refugee status
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Reasonable possibility, not balance of probabilities
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: N/A – no sentencing in refugee context
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Alleged misinterpretation of evidence by RPD
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee appeal and federal court judicial review
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to RPD decision

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim involving financial exploitation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for refugee protection based on past financial coercion
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No evidence of ongoing financial threats post-conviction
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate well-founded fear
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Fear tied to individual criminal, not systemic issue
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Changed country conditions negate need for protection
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Claimant alleged inadequate analysis by RPD
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Misinterpretation of threat level and evidence
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA and jurisprudence on state protection
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 96 – definition of Convention refugee
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on persecution and state protection
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Domestic refugee law aligned with international obligations

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on coercive lending practices by criminal network
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether loan-sharking constitutes grounds for refugee protection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No proof of ongoing loan-sharking threats
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Mr. Kudar to show continued risk
Crimes.Legal_Rule: State protection negates need for refugee status
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Conviction of Atyanski, improved law enforcement
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA and precedent on non-state actors
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Subjective fear supported by objective evidence
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Threat no longer active due to legal sanctions
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Stay in Canada as protected person
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections relating to risk from non-state actors
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian immigration system, Hungarian origin context

Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Main perpetrator imprisoned; law enforcement response improved
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient to prove ongoing extortion risk
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible past events, but future risk unproven

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
